name: Classical
description: Western art music spanning Baroque, Romantic, and modern eras.

name: Jazz
description: Improvisational music rooted in blues and swing; includes bebop, fusion, and smooth jazz.

name: Blues
description: Expressive music rooted in African American traditions; includes Delta, Chicago, and electric blues.

name: Rock
description: Guitar-driven music evolving from blues and pop; spans classic rock, punk, grunge, and indie.

name: Pop
description: Mainstream melodic music emphasizing accessibility, melody, and production quality.

name: Hip-Hop / Rap
description: Lyric- and rhythm-based genre with roots in urban storytelling; includes old-school, trap, and drill.

name: R&B / Soul
description: Smooth, vocal-driven music evolving from gospel and blues; focuses on emotion and groove.

name: Electronic / Dance
description: Electronic sound production; includes techno, house, trance, drum & bass, and ambient styles.

name: Folk
description: Traditional and contemporary storytelling music rooted in community or cultural identity.

name: Country
description: American roots music emphasizing personal storytelling and regional identity.

name: Reggae / Ska / Dancehall
description: Caribbean rhythm-focused music with social and spiritual themes.

name: Latin / Afro-Latin
description: Includes salsa, bachata, reggaetón, bossa nova, and tango—rhythmic and dance-oriented.

name: Afrobeat / Highlife / African Traditional
description: Modern and traditional African styles blending rhythm, melody, and community energy.

name: Metal
description: Heavy offshoot of rock emphasizing power, speed, and dark or epic themes.

name: Punk / Alternative / Indie
description: Independent, anti-mainstream expressions branching from rock and pop.

name: Funk / Disco
description: Rhythm- and bass-driven music built for dance and movement.

name: Gospel / Christian / Spiritual
description: Religious or spiritual music celebrating faith through vocal harmony and emotion.

name: World / Traditional / Ethnic
description: Indigenous and folk music from all regions, often tied to ceremony or cultural heritage.

name: Experimental / Avant-Garde
description: Music that explores new sonic, structural, or conceptual territories.

name: Soundtrack / Score / Stage
description: Composed for film, theater, or games; focuses on enhancing narrative emotion.
